Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

Six Grandes études de Paganini, S. 141

1851 · LW A173 · R. 3b

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 26' 30"

  • 1. G minor
  • 2. E-flat major
  • 3. G-sharp minor (La campanella)
  • 4. E major
  • 5. E major
  • 6. A minor
  • 6. A minor (introduction, S. 141/6bis)

The études are arrangements of works by Nicolò Paganini. The collection also exists in an earlier version from 1838, the Six Études d’exécution transcendante d’après Paganini (S. 140; LW A52; R. 3a).

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · I/2 · Z. A/B 5412 · Studies II · ed. Zoltán Gárdonyi / István Szelényi
  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · Suppl. 12 · Z. A/B 14567 · ed. Adrienne Kaczmarczyk [introduction to no. 6]
  • Editio Musica Budapest · Z. 6500 · ed. Zoltán Gárdonyi / István Szelényi

1. G minor

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 6) that includes the introduction to another caprice (op. 1 no. 5).

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 4

2. E-flat major

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 17).

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

3. G-sharp minor (La campanella)

This is based on a theme from the final movement of the second violin concerto (op. 7). In the 1838 version, Liszt included also material based on the final movement of the first violin concerto (op. 6). Liszt also uses the theme from the second concerto in his Grande Fantaisie de bravoure sur La Clochette (S. 420; LW A15; R. 231) and Grande Fantaisie sur des thèmes de Paganini (S. 700a/i; LW A113; R. 231 and S. 700a/ii; LW A113; R. 231).

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 5

4. E major

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 1).

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

5. E major

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 9).

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 4

6. A minor

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 24).

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 5

6. A minor (introduction, S. 141/6bis)

In 1884, Liszt wrote a short album leaf that can serve as an introduction to this étude.

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 1.5
